Lors de cette longue nuit Â« cathartique Â», toute la vÃ©ritÃ© devra Ãªtre dite sur ses origines Â« mythiques Â», sa dictature tyrannique, ses mensonges et ses innombrables crimes et assassinats.

NÃ©e au Burkina-Faso, ElÃ©onore Yameogo s'est tournÃ©e avec dÃ©termination vers une passion difficile d'accÃ¨s pour une femme en Afrique : la rÃ©alisation. Elle se forme d'abord sur les nombreux tournages de Ouagadougou oÃ¹ elle acquiert une solide expÃ©rience de terrain, avant d'entrer Ã  l'Institut SupÃ©rieur de l'Image et du Son au Burkina-Faso.
En 2007, elle co-rÃ©alise un film documentaire Parole croisÃ©e, regard de femmes. Toujours en 2007, elle bÃ©nÃ©ficie d'une bourse de la CommunautÃ© FranÃ§aise de Belgique afin d'effectuer un stage en rÃ©alisation sur le film Murmure au sein de l'association films et culture en Belgique.
En janvier 2008, elle effectue en France un stage en rÃ©alisation Ã  Pom Films Ã  Paris et commence le dÃ©veloppement d'un documentaire Paris mon Paradis.
En 2009, elle rÃ©alise un film documentaire sur les sans-abri, La main tendue, sÃ©lectionnÃ© au Fespaco 2009.
En 2011, elle signe son premier long mÃ©trage Paris mon paradis, dÃ©jÃ  prÃ©sentÃ© dans une vingtaine de festivals en Europe et en Afrique.
ElÃ©onore appartient Ã  la jeune gÃ©nÃ©ration de rÃ©alisatrices africaines dÃ©sireuse de se frotter Ã  des sujets documentaires exigeants. Elle a Ã  coeur de faire valoir et de porter un nouveau regard africain hors de son continent d'origine.

title: Yaaba
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

Living in a small West African village are the boy Bila and his girl friend Nopoko. Their days are spent on the lush savannah. As time passes by, a tension begins to brews in the nearby village. A pretty woman married to an alcoholic is having an shameless affair!

description:
Le Burkina Faso est un pays enclavÃ© en Afrique de l'Ouest, entourÃ© de six autres pays: le Mali, le Niger, le BÃ©nin, le Togo, le Ghana et la CÃ´te d'Ivoire. La langue officielle du Bourkina Faso est le franÃ§ais, bien que de nombreuses autres langues soient Ã©galement parlÃ©es, notamment MoorÃ©, Joula et FoulfouldÃ©.

Le Burkina Faso Ã©tait Ã  l'origine connu sous le nom de la Haute-Volta, un nom qui a Ã©tÃ© donnÃ© au pays par des colonisateurs franÃ§ais, Ã  la fin du 19e siÃ¨cle. Le nom " Haute Volta " faisait rÃ©fÃ©rence Ã  l'emplacement du pays, qui est situÃ© le long des tronÃ§ons supÃ©rieurs de la riviÃ¨re Volta.

L'histoire du Bourkina Faso remonte au 11Ã¨me siÃ¨cle, lorsque les royaumes de Mossi ont Ã©tÃ© Ã©tablis dans la rÃ©gion. Le peuple Mossi Ã©tait des agriculteurs et des guerriers qualifiÃ©s, et leurs royaumes se sont dÃ©veloppÃ©s pour devenir parmi les plus grands, et les plus puissants d'Afrique de l'Ouest. Ils ont Ã©changÃ© avec des tribus voisines, et Ã©taient connus pour leurs industries en terrassement et textile. Ã€ la fin du XIXe siÃ¨cle, le Burkina Faso est devenu un protectorat franÃ§ais, et les royaumes Mossi ont Ã©tÃ© progressivement incorporÃ©s dans l'empire colonial franÃ§ais. AprÃ¨s une longue lutte pour l'indÃ©pendance, le Burkina Faso a acquis sa libertÃ© de France, en 1960.

Le premier prÃ©sident du pays, Maurice YamÃ©ogo, a Ã©tabli un Ã‰tat Ã  parti unique, mais il a Ã©tÃ© renversÃ© lors d'un coup d'Ã‰tat en 1966. Dans les annÃ©es qui ont suivi, le Bourkina Faso a traversÃ© une sÃ©rie de coups d'Ã‰tat et de bouleversements politiques. Le capitaine Thomas Sankara a saisi le pouvoir en 1983, et s'est lancÃ© dans un programme de rÃ©formes sociales et Ã©conomiques, notamment la redistribution des terres, l'Ã©ducation gratuite et les soins de santÃ©, et une campagne contre la corruption. Le gouvernement de Sankara Ã©tait populaire, parmi les jeunes et les pauvres, mais il a Ã©galement Ã©tÃ© critiquÃ© pour son autoritarisme et ses violations des droits de l'homme.

Sankara a Ã©tÃ© assassinÃ©e lors d'un coup d'Ã‰tat en 1987, et son ancien ami et alliÃ©, Blaise CommpaorÃ©, a pris le pouvoir. CompaorÃ© a gouvernÃ© le pays pendant 27 ans, pendant lesquels le Bourkina Faso est devenu un acteur clÃ© de la politique rÃ©gionale. CompaorÃ© a Ã©tÃ© renversÃ© dans un soulÃ¨vement populaire en 2014, et le pays a depuis traversÃ© une pÃ©riode de transition politique et de consolidation. Aujourd'hui, le Bourkina Faso est une sociÃ©tÃ© dynamique avec un riche patrimoine culturel, et un engagement envers la dÃ©mocratie et les droits de l'homme.

Quel film !', "This film is obviously beyond simple comments. It compels scholarly interests in terms of analysis. The Sun (s), the title of that book is a metaphor to indigenous and post colonial legendary personalities, such as Soundiata, Tieno Bocar, Lamizana and Madiba to name but a few. In addition, the film smartly compares these frican legends to the western scholars and great intellectual s who purposely distorted the image of Africa and denied africans from the very notion of intellegible humanity to vendicate the western dehumanizing practices like slavery colonialims and imperialism. Morever, the film talks directly to the african youth and diagnoses it state through the character of Dokamissa, the namesake of soundiata's grand mother. Dokamissa is sick, she doesn't recognize even his grand Father. This is where the film shows that african youth has forgotten it's pass. What is more dramatic Dokamissa knows Volter but not Tierno Bocar from Badiangara who has been and remains a knowledgeable wise man. 
  By the same time, this film is teaching about the Kouroukan fouga chatter which is ignored today though it is the world's first contitution. 
In brief terms, this film is revising the  glorious pass of Africa to teach the troubled and confused african youth in order to cure it from those sicknesses mainly provoked by the western knowledge. By western knowledge, I'M referring to the discursive production of african subject by the western scholars like Hegel and Victor Hugo.
Please. Le peuple Mossi Ã©tait des agriculteurs et des guerriers qualifiÃ©s, et leurs royaumes se sont dÃ©veloppÃ©s pour devenir parmi les plus grands, et les plus puissants d'Afrique de l'Ouest. Ils ont Ã©changÃ© avec des tribus voisines, et Ã©taient connus pour leurs industries en terrassement et textile. Ã€ la fin du XIXe siÃ¨cle, le Burkina Faso est devenu un protectorat franÃ§ais, et les royaumes Mossi ont Ã©tÃ© progressivement incorporÃ©s dans l'empire colonial franÃ§ais. AprÃ¨s une longue lutte pour l'indÃ©pendance, le Burkina Faso a acquis sa libertÃ© de France, en 1960.

Le premier prÃ©sident du pays, Maurice YamÃ©ogo, a Ã©tabli un Ã‰tat Ã  parti unique, mais il a Ã©tÃ© renversÃ© lors d'un coup d'Ã‰tat en 1966. Dans les annÃ©es qui ont suivi, le Bourkina Faso a traversÃ© une sÃ©rie de coups d'Ã‰tat et de bouleversements politiques. Le capitaine Thomas Sankara a saisi le pouvoir en 1983, et s'est lancÃ© dans un programme de rÃ©formes sociales et Ã©conomiques, notamment la redistribution des terres, l'Ã©ducation gratuite et les soins de santÃ©, et une campagne contre la corruption. Le gouvernement de Sankara Ã©tait populaire, parmi les jeunes et les pauvres, mais il a Ã©galement Ã©tÃ© critiquÃ© pour son autoritarisme et ses violations des droits de l'homme.

CompaorÃ© a Ã©tÃ© renversÃ© dans un soulÃ¨vement populaire en 2014, et le pays a depuis traversÃ© une pÃ©riode de transition politique et de consolidation. title: MASSOUD!, un film de Emmanuel Rotoubam MbaÃ¯dÃ© (Burkina Faso)
channel: L'AFRIQUE FAIT SON CINEMA, FESTIVAL DURABLE
description:
Massoud, a young and open-minded student works as a tourist guide in his spare time. He is passionate about culture and art. He is the only son of Barkaye, a respected and tolerant Imam of a small village community in the Sahel region.

His life will be turned upside down by the daily injustices he sees in his native region. The insecurity is getting out of hand. The straw that broke the camelâ€™s back will be the tragic killing of a close friend by the security forces. Little by little, Massoud gets radicalized and his discourse changes. His love affair with Flora, a journalist who came from Europe to investigate terrorism in the Sahel takes a hit, because of his growing interest in radical teachings. Massoud ends up joining a terrorist movement. The two lovers lose all contact, until the day he discovers Flora, kidnapped and jailed in one of the terrorist camp's cells along with other European nationals.

Day after day, attacks against civilians and security forces are organized and perpetrated by the terrorist leader and his henchmen. Under the cover of Islamism, the latter maintains various traffics with the help of Pascal, a European adventurer and former member of the special services. Pascal happens to find out that Flora, the journalist, is his natural daughter whom he conceived during one of his missions in the Sahel.

Paranoid and malicious, the terrorist leader Abdoulaye suspects Massoud's father of providing information to the security forces. He doesn't like the moderate speech of the imam who condemns in his sermons the attacks and the recruitment of young terrorists. The imam is a true advocate of tolerance, and gets more and more in the way of the radical terror movements.
One day, Abdoulaye decides to carry out an attack on the mosque and eliminate the moderate imam. It is to Massoud that he entrusts this task to eliminate his father.

Will Massoud accomplish his mission?

Pour rÃ©cupÃ©rer la mÃ©tÃ©orite de sa maman Nadjouma et le Saint Coran du marabout Bokano, les deux fondements de son Â« pouvoir Â», Koyaga, le maÃ®tre chasseur, doit faire rÃ©citer son donsomana lors dâ€™une veillÃ©e purificatoire menÃ©e par le Griot musicien de la confrÃ©rie des chasseurs et TiÃ©coura son rÃ©pondeur.

title: Les maÃ®tres du nyama - Burkina Faso - Bande annonce - Un film de Patrick KersalÃ©
description:

https://geozik.org/fr/91-contenu-fran...

Au Burkina Faso, la confrÃ©rie initiatique des chasseurs sÃ©noufo perpÃ©tue des traditions millÃ©naires. Elle prÃªche la libertÃ©, lâ€™Ã©galitÃ©, la fraternitÃ© et lâ€™entente entre tous les hommes, sans distinction de classe, de naissance, de croyance ni dâ€™origine. Si le fusil sâ€™est aujourdâ€™hui substituÃ© Ã  lâ€™arc, le rapport de force existant entre lâ€™homme et lâ€™animal nâ€™en a pas pour autant Ã©tÃ© rompu. Lorsquâ€™il expire, le gibier libÃ¨re une force vengeresse, le nyama, qui poursuit le chasseur sa vie durant. Gris-gris, plantes et priÃ¨res magiques, mais aussi musique, danses et pantomimes lâ€™aideront Ã  lâ€™exorciser et Ã  lâ€™apprivoiser. Des chantres, armÃ©s de leur seule parole et de leur harpe-luth, ont la charge de transmettre la connaissance et de louanger les hommes les plus valeureux.

description:
Le Burkina Faso est un pays enclavÃ© en Afrique de l'Ouest, entourÃ© de six autres pays: le Mali, le Niger, le BÃ©nin, le Togo, le Ghana et la CÃ´te d'Ivoire. La langue officielle du Bourkina Faso est le franÃ§ais, bien que de nombreuses autres langues soient Ã©galement parlÃ©es, notamment MoorÃ©, Joula et FoulfouldÃ©.

Le Burkina Faso Ã©tait Ã  l'origine connu sous le nom de la Haute-Volta, un nom qui a Ã©tÃ© donnÃ© au pays par des colonisateurs franÃ§ais, Ã  la fin du 19e siÃ¨cle. Le nom " Haute Volta " faisait rÃ©fÃ©rence Ã  l'emplacement du pays, qui est situÃ© le long des tronÃ§ons supÃ©rieurs de la riviÃ¨re Volta.

L'histoire du Bourkina Faso remonte au 11Ã¨me siÃ¨cle, lorsque les royaumes de Mossi ont Ã©tÃ© Ã©tablis dans la rÃ©gion. Le peuple Mossi Ã©tait des agriculteurs et des guerriers qualifiÃ©s, et leurs royaumes se sont dÃ©veloppÃ©s pour devenir parmi les plus grands, et les plus puissants d'Afrique de l'Ouest. Ils ont Ã©changÃ© avec des tribus voisines, et Ã©taient connus pour leurs industries en terrassement et textile. Ã€ la fin du XIXe siÃ¨cle, le Burkina Faso est devenu un protectorat franÃ§ais, et les royaumes Mossi ont Ã©tÃ© progressivement incorporÃ©s dans l'empire colonial franÃ§ais. AprÃ¨s une longue lutte pour l'indÃ©pendance, le Burkina Faso a acquis sa libertÃ© de France, en 1960.

Le premier prÃ©sident du pays, Maurice YamÃ©ogo, a Ã©tabli un Ã‰tat Ã  parti unique, mais il a Ã©tÃ© renversÃ© lors d'un coup d'Ã‰tat en 1966. Dans les annÃ©es qui ont suivi, le Bourkina Faso a traversÃ© une sÃ©rie de coups d'Ã‰tat et de bouleversements politiques. Le capitaine Thomas Sankara a saisi le pouvoir en 1983, et s'est lancÃ© dans un programme de rÃ©formes sociales et Ã©conomiques, notamment la redistribution des terres, l'Ã©ducation gratuite et les soins de santÃ©, et une campagne contre la corruption. Le gouvernement de Sankara Ã©tait populaire, parmi les jeunes et les pauvres, mais il a Ã©galement Ã©tÃ© critiquÃ© pour son autoritarisme et ses violations des droits de l'homme.

Sankara a Ã©tÃ© assassinÃ©e lors d'un coup d'Ã‰tat en 1987, et son ancien ami et alliÃ©, Blaise CommpaorÃ©, a pris le pouvoir. CompaorÃ© a gouvernÃ© le pays pendant 27 ans, pendant lesquels le Bourkina Faso est devenu un acteur clÃ© de la politique rÃ©gionale. CompaorÃ© a Ã©tÃ© renversÃ© dans un soulÃ¨vement populaire en 2014, et le pays a depuis traversÃ© une pÃ©riode de transition politique et de consolidation. Aujourd'hui, le Bourkina Faso est une sociÃ©tÃ© dynamique avec un riche patrimoine culturel, et un engagement envers la dÃ©mocratie et les droits de l'homme.

On doit apprendre Ã  gÃ©rer son foyer, et la sociÃ©tÃ© se gÃ©rera dâ€™elle mÃªme.', "La dame qui parle de norme sociÃ©tale ne sait pas ce qu'elle dit. MÃªme s'il existe une norme soi-disant sociÃ©tale, l'Ã©pouse devrait comprendre que son mari n'a pas fait exprÃ¨s pour en freindre la norme sociÃ©tale. C'est parce qu'il a perdu son travail qu'il ne rÃ©ussit plus Ã  assumer ses responsabilitÃ©s. La preuve en est qu'il les assumait quand Ã§a allait. Et si aujourd'hui Ã§a ne va plus et que Dieu a permis que la femme puisse avoir les moyens pour supporter les charges du foyer, il faut Ãªtre fonciÃ¨rement animal pour se laisser emporter par un soi-disant moule sociÃ©tal. Il n'y a rien qui puisse justifier l'attitude de la femme . Elle est tout simplement mÃ©chante. C'est une sorciÃ¨re.", 'Je ne suis pas dâ€™accord avec la dame. La norme sociÃ©taire est-Elle la meilleure??? Câ€™est une pÃ©riode de vache maigre et mÃªme si cela devait durer 5 ans, elle devait soutenir son homme.', "La chirurgienne a un problÃ¨me. Est-ce que c'Ã©tait Ã  l'homme de lui scolariser?"]

title: Les Bobodiouf - Compilation #1

Qui sont les Bobodiouf ? Les Bobodiouf sont comme vous et moi, surtout comme vous ! 
Pourquoi chez les Bobodiouf il y a toujours des problÃ¨mes ? Il faut dire que chacun y met du sien pour en trouver. Il ne se passe pas une journÃ©e sans quâ€™il nâ€™arrive quelque chose Ã  lâ€™un dâ€™entre eux, quand ce nâ€™est pas Ã  toute la famille. 
Heureusement, chez les Bobodiouf, on trouve toujours une solution appropriÃ©e, mÃªme si câ€™est au dÃ©triment de lâ€™un des membres de la famille. Que voulez-vous, chez les Bobodiouf, on est tous solidaires, surtout pour soi-mÃªme. 
AprÃ¨s le fulgurant succÃ¨s de la saison 1, lâ€™une des sÃ©ries les plus regardÃ©es par la diaspora africaine, voici enfin le retour des Bobodiouf avec des problÃ¨mes, des histoires encore plus cocasses, et toujours le mÃªme humour Ã  faire tomber par terre.

title: Delwende
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

In Burkina Faso, a country confronted with poverty and archaic traditions, ancestral customs are regarded as laws. In the countryside, unexplained deaths are often attributed to 'soul eaters', women with occult and malignant powers whom villagers hold responsible for these disappearances. They are outcast and become the scapegoats of an entire community.

title: BURKINABE - Official Trailer (HD)
description:
Teka Films in collaboration with Goethe-Institut Ouagadougou, presents BURKINABE. The project is a collaboration between production, cast and crew from South African and Burkina Faso respectively. The film is a description of African youth battling with the tension between our rural roots and our urban realities. 

OUT JUNE 21 2019

"YOUR BODY MAY LEAVE HOME, BUT NEVER YOUR SPIRIT."

Mariam, returns to Burkina Faso after having left as a young child who was adopted and sent out of the country to South Africa, where she always felt alien. She returns as an ailing young adult to the land of her birth on a journey of self discovery, to spend her last days in the land of her forefathers. She does not know the language, culture, or norms. She is on a quest to reconnect with her family and her roots. While trying to figure out how to get to her native village, she encounters and befriends a charismatic bike messenger/taxi driver, Moussa, who volunteers to take her South, claiming good knowledge of the country and the exact place of her village. A city slicker bike messenger, Moussa, is living a fast paced life in the city. His life is lonely as the debt is building up and he is estranged from his family living in a remote village. Outwardly Moussa seems in control, hiding behind his charm, charisma and style. Moussa grows increasingly paranoid in Ouagadougou as his debts mount up. He needs to get out. Moussa and Mariam take to the open road on a journey of self discovery. 


Written & Directed By: Nthato Mokgata & Carla Fonseca

Cast: 
Carla Fonseca
Dramane Ouedraogo
Josiane Yeri Hien
Christ Nathan Jason Mbaide

Music by Salif Diarra; Chobolo Manyelo; Nthato Mokgata

title: Dans lâ€™univers des dialysÃ©s au Burkina Faso ; un film de MaÃ¯mouna TraorÃ©
Burkina Faso : The Traditional Dance of the Mossi Peopleï¼šThe Warba Dance
channel: Africa Fixer : Filming in Africa : Field Producer
description:
A traditional dance of the Mossi people of Burkina Faso: the Warba Dance.
Footage from an Africa fixer, a television producer working all over Africa. To see our collection of photos from our shoots in Burkina Faso,  go here: https://www.excelman.jpn.com/en/galer...
The Mossi are a Gur ethnic group native to modern Burkina Faso, primarily the Volta River basin. The Mossi are the largest ethnic group in Burkina Faso, constituting 52% of the population, or about 11.1 million people. The other 48% of Burkina Faso's population is composed of more than 60 ethnic groups, mainly the Gurunsi, Senufo, Lobi, Bobo and Fulani. The Mossi speak the MÃ²orÃ© language. 
 According to Mossi mythology, the Mosi royal family was founded by a king named Ouedraogo, born to a Dagomba princess and a Mande hunter in what is now northern Ghana. 
According to historical accounts, the Mossi kingdom rose in this region in the mid-15th century with Tengodogo as its capital, and its powerful cavalry kept it independent from the Mali Empire and the Kingdom of Songai, which were at the height of their power at the time. After a while, Northern Mossi, with Ouagadougou as their capital, became independent from Southern Mosi, with Tengodogo as its capital, and were divided into three independent states, each maintaining its independence until the 19th century. A ethnic group living in Burkina Faso (formerly Haute-Volta), in a savanna region in the interior of West Africa. The population is about 2 million.

title: Delwende
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

In Burkina Faso, a country confronted with poverty and archaic traditions, ancestral customs are regarded as laws. In the countryside, unexplained deaths are often attributed to 'soul eaters', women with occult and malignant powers whom villagers hold responsible for these disappearances. They are outcast and become the scapegoats of an entire community.

Burkina Faso Army Carries Out Operations
description:
Burkinabe troops carried out jihadist hunting operations through the first half of November near Burkina Fasoâ€™s border with Mali.
â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“
READ MORE: The Burkina Faso army said, Sunday, November 17,  it had killed 32 "terrorists" in two operations in the north of the country after an attack on a patrol.
 
The impoverished and politically fragile Sahel country has been struggling to quell a rising jihadist revolt that has claimed hundreds of lives since early 2015.
 
The country's badly equipped, poorly trained and underfunded security forces have been unable to stem the violence, which has intensified throughout 2019 to become almost daily.
 
The Sahel region, including Burkina Faso's neighbors Mali and Niger, has been afflicted by the violence despite the presence of the regional G5 Sahel force as well as French and U.S. troops.

title: Film africain - Samba TraorÃ© (Burkina Faso)
description:
SYNOPSIS
Apres avoir participe au hold-up d'une station service, Samba se refugie dans son village. Il retrouve Saratou qu'il epouse avant d'ouvrir le bar de ses reves avec son ami Salif. Mais le village s'interroge sur l'origine de ses moyens et quand Saratou doit partir accoucher a la ville, Samba comprend qu'il risque d'y etre reconnu...

title: The man who plants baobabs: A Burkina Faso hero | Africa Direct Documentary
description:
El Hadji Salifou OuÃ©draogo has nurtured thousands of baobab trees from tiny seeds to expansive forests for the past 47 years. The trees in turn help his family, his village and the Earth.

Filmmaker Michel K Zongoâ€™s uplifting film, The Man Who Plants Baobabs, meets this charismatic old man with a youthful spirit and a lifelong commitment to his trees, which are both a lifeline and a legacy for his community.

Michel K Zongo is a cinematographer and director based in Burkina Faso. He has made three feature-length documentaries that have screened internationally and won several awards. He is also the artistic director of the Koudougou Doc Festival and has been an Academy (â€˜Oscarsâ€™) member since 2020.

More from Africa Direct on:
- YouTube: https://aje.me/AJAfricaDirect-YT
- Twitter:   / ajafricadirect  
- Facebook:   / ajafricadirect  
- Instagram:   / ajafricadirect  
- Website: http://aljazeera.com/program/africa-d...

#Documentary #BurkinaFaso #AfricaDirect

title: Burkina Faso: The War against School | ARTE.tv Documentary
description:
They are waging a systematic war against education. More than two and a half million school children in Burkina Faso currently no longer have classes. For the country with its 20 million inhabitants, this is an enormous number of children who can no longer exercise their right to schooling because Islamist terrorists consider education harmful.

title: Un film plaidoyer pour les prisonniers du Burkina Faso
description:
Au regard des violations multiples et multiformes des droits des dÃ©tenus dans les prisons au Burkina Faso, l'Association Semfilms-Burkina, en partenariat avec le Mouvement BurkinabÃ© des Droits de l'Homme et des Peuples (MBDHP), a initiÃ© un projet de sensibilisation sur les thÃ©matiques spÃ©cifiques de l'humanisation des conditions de dÃ©tention, l'interdiction de la torture et les autres peines ou traitements cruels, inhumains ou dÃ©gradants.

Ce projet vise Ã  couvrir l'ensemble des quarante cinq (45) provinces du pays et porte sur les Ã©lÃ©ments suivants:

- Des projections du film Â« Une vie de cachot Â»
- Des modules de formation sur les normes internes et internationales de la dÃ©tention 
- L'interpellation du gouvernement sur la nÃ©cessitÃ© d'adopter une loi interne dÃ©finissant et rÃ©primant les actes de torture et les pratiques assimilÃ©es.

Ce reportage suit l'Ã©quipe de projection dans 2 localitÃ©s, notamment Sapouy et LÃ©o.

title: Les Bobodiouf - Compilation #1
description:
Qui sont les Bobodiouf ? Les Bobodiouf sont comme vous et moi, surtout comme vous ! 
Pourquoi chez les Bobodiouf il y a toujours des problÃ¨mes ? Il faut dire que chacun y met du sien pour en trouver. Il ne se passe pas une journÃ©e sans quâ€™il nâ€™arrive quelque chose Ã  lâ€™un dâ€™entre eux, quand ce nâ€™est pas Ã  toute la famille. 
Heureusement, chez les Bobodiouf, on trouve toujours une solution appropriÃ©e, mÃªme si câ€™est au dÃ©triment de lâ€™un des membres de la famille. Que voulez-vous, chez les Bobodiouf, on est tous solidaires, surtout pour soi-mÃªme. 
AprÃ¨s le fulgurant succÃ¨s de la saison 1, lâ€™une des sÃ©ries les plus regardÃ©es par la diaspora africaine, voici enfin le retour des Bobodiouf avec des problÃ¨mes, des histoires encore plus cocasses, et toujours le mÃªme humour Ã  faire tomber par terre.

Ecrit et RÃ©alisÃ© par Patrick Martinet 
Une production Frame / Burkina-Fasso

title: Africa's largest film festival kicks off in Burkina Faso
description:
15,000 people, including cinema celebrities from Nigeria, Senegal and Ivory Coast are expected in Ouagadougou for FESPACO, Africa's biggest film festival that was launched in 1969. This year's theme is "African cinema and culture of peace".

title: Pindoubane - An Educational Film in Jula / Dioula / Bambara from Burkina Faso
description: "Pindoubane" was produced by Troupe Brigue of Beregadougou and Peace Corps Burkina Faso. It has been viewed by thousands of West Africans and is currently screening aboard multiple bus lines, including Rahimo, TCV, and Rakieta. It includes many important lessons of family planning, women's empowerment, and health clinic de-stigmatization targeting rural and urban populations of southwest Burkina Faso.

title: MASSOUD!, un film de Emmanuel Rotoubam MbaÃ¯dÃ© (Burkina Faso)
channel: L'AFRIQUE FAIT SON CINEMA, FESTIVAL DURABLE
description:
Massoud, a young and open-minded student works as a tourist guide in his spare time. He is passionate about culture and art. He is the only son of Barkaye, a respected and tolerant Imam of a small village community in the Sahel region.

His life will be turned upside down by the daily injustices he sees in his native region. The insecurity is getting out of hand. The straw that broke the camelâ€™s back will be the tragic killing of a close friend by the security forces. Little by little, Massoud gets radicalized and his discourse changes. His love affair with Flora, a journalist who came from Europe to investigate terrorism in the Sahel takes a hit, because of his growing interest in radical teachings. Massoud ends up joining a terrorist movement. The two lovers lose all contact, until the day he discovers Flora, kidnapped and jailed in one of the terrorist camp's cells along with other European nationals.

Day after day, attacks against civilians and security forces are organized and perpetrated by the terrorist leader and his henchmen. Under the cover of Islamism, the latter maintains various traffics with the help of Pascal, a European adventurer and former member of the special services. Pascal happens to find out that Flora, the journalist, is his natural daughter whom he conceived during one of his missions in the Sahel.

Paranoid and malicious, the terrorist leader Abdoulaye suspects Massoud's father of providing information to the security forces. He doesn't like the moderate speech of the imam who condemns in his sermons the attacks and the recruitment of young terrorists. The imam is a true advocate of tolerance, and gets more and more in the way of the radical terror movements.
One day, Abdoulaye decides to carry out an attack on the mosque and eliminate the moderate imam. It is to Massoud that he entrusts this task to eliminate his father.

Will Massoud accomplish his mission?

title: NON LOTI Film BurkinabeÌ€ reÌaliseÌ par Abdoul BAGUE
BRAVO, BURKINA! Trailer â€“ 2023 New African Film Festival
description:
BRAVO, BURKINA! 
Sun, March 19, 7:00 p.m.; Thurs, March 23, 7:00 p.m. 
 
Filmmaker and designer WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ© â€” whose fashion designs appear in Marvel's BLACK PANTHER films â€” crafts this imaginative debut feature about a BurkinabÃ¨ boy who migrates to Italy and later discovers a way to go back in time and regain what he lost. A multidimensional exploration of love and migration, this poetic story bends time to explore the meaning of existing in two states â€” both coming and going, running away and running toward. From the community in Burkina Faso to the two central protagonists walking the streets of an Italian village, OyÃ©jidÃ©'s characters exude humanity and confidence. OyÃ©jidÃ© is invested in evolving the narrative of migrants, leveraging his background in fashion to assert his characters' dignity and fullness. Direct confrontations with the camera lure viewers in while an evocative score guides them through a dreamy, mystical journey. A lyrical experience and one that flows beyond the frame, BRAVO, BURKINA! is a daring invitation to imagine what could be. (Note adapted from Sundance Film Festival.) Official Selection, 2023 Sundance Film Festival. DIR/SCR/PROD WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ©; PROD Giulia Alagna, Heather Barnes. U.S., 2023, color, 64 min. In Moore and Italian with English subtitles. NOT RATED 
 
For the full lineup and to purchase tickets and passes, visit: https://bit.ly/NewAfricanFF2023
 
CONNECT WITH AFI SILVER: http://AFI.com/Silver  
Twitter: @AFISilver  
FB & IG: @afisilvertheatre  
Podcast: bit.ly/SilverStreams

title: FILM sur le Dialogue Inter Religieux au Burkina Faso

title: Film OUAGA STREET ART TOUR - Ouagadougou - Burkina Faso
description:
OUAGA STREET ART TOUR 2023

RÃ©alisÃ© par Martin DEMAY/RASCAProd 

Ce projet vise Ã  mettre en valeur le patrimoine urbain et humain de la capitale par lâ€™organisation dâ€™une sÃ©rie dâ€™actions artistiques, de fÃ©vrier Ã  juin 2023, Ã  Ouagadougou.

 
12 fresques murales ont Ã©tÃ© rÃ©alisÃ©es dans 12 quartiers de Ouagadougou par le street artiste El Marto. Elles valorisent la culture burkinabÃ© en s'appuyant sur des rÃ©fÃ©rences identitaires fortes liÃ©es Ã  chaque localitÃ©. Ces fresques, Ã  mi-chemin entre graffiti et dessin, se composent du lettrage du nom du quartier avec lâ€™ajout de symboles mettant en avant de maniÃ¨re originale les caractÃ©ristiques qui composent lâ€™identitÃ© du quartier.

La collecte de ces rÃ©fÃ©rences a supposÃ© un temps d'immersion. Elle a Ã©tÃ© organisÃ©e, dans chaque localitÃ©, en partenariat avec une association Å“uvrant pour l'amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie des femmes au Burkina Faso. Des rencontres intergÃ©nÃ©rationnelles, entre jeunes et anciens du quartier, ont ainsi Ã©tÃ© mises en place pour susciter un dialogue sur lâ€™histoire du quartier, sa singularitÃ© et ses Ã©volutions dans le but de faire Ã©merger une Â« identitÃ© Â» et ainsi crÃ©er la fresque du quartier.

En parallÃ¨le, des ateliers dâ€™initiation aux Â« arts urbains Â» (graffiti / photographie urbaine / break dance) ont Ã©tÃ© dispensÃ©s en direction de 360 femmes issues des associations fÃ©minines partenaires.

 

Les quartiers de cette 1Ã¨re Ã©dition : SAMANDIN, OUIDI, TAMPOUY, TANGHIN, DAGNOÃ‹N, PISSY, NAGRIN, ZAGTOULI, KAMBOINSIN, BENDOGO, KARPALA, PATTE Dâ€™OIE.

RÃ©alisÃ© par Martin DEMAY/RASCAProd 

Ce projet vise Ã  mettre en valeur le patrimoine urbain et humain de la capitale par lâ€™organisation dâ€™une sÃ©rie dâ€™actions artistiques, de fÃ©vrier Ã  juin 2023, Ã  Ouagadougou.

Elles valorisent la culture burkinabÃ© en s'appuyant sur des rÃ©fÃ©rences identitaires fortes liÃ©es Ã  chaque localitÃ©. Ces fresques, Ã  mi-chemin entre graffiti et dessin, se composent du lettrage du nom du quartier avec lâ€™ajout de symboles mettant en avant de maniÃ¨re originale les caractÃ©ristiques qui composent lâ€™identitÃ© du quartier.

La collecte de ces rÃ©fÃ©rences a supposÃ© un temps d'immersion. Elle a Ã©tÃ© organisÃ©e, dans chaque localitÃ©, en partenariat avec une association Å“uvrant pour l'amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie des femmes au Burkina Faso. Des rencontres intergÃ©nÃ©rationnelles, entre jeunes et anciens du quartier, ont ainsi Ã©tÃ© mises en place pour susciter un dialogue sur lâ€™histoire du quartier, sa singularitÃ© et ses Ã©volutions dans le but de faire Ã©merger une Â« identitÃ© Â» et ainsi crÃ©er la fresque du quartier.

En parallÃ¨le, des ateliers dâ€™initiation aux Â« arts urbains Â» (graffiti / photographie urbaine / break dance) ont Ã©tÃ© dispensÃ©s en direction de 360 femmes issues des associations fÃ©minines partenaires.

title: Burkina 2002 - TingandÃ©, la peau de la terre
description:
LE FILM
"Burkina 2002", c'est le nom du projet qu'un groupe de jeunes a rÃ©alisÃ© au cÅ“ur de la brousse africaine du Burkina Faso. Entre 2001 et 2002, j'ai suivi un groupe de jeunes et leur animateur dans leur projet humanitaire : de la naissance de l'idÃ©e jusqu'Ã  son application en Afrique. Peu aprÃ¨s, je les ai interviewÃ©s un Ã  un pour qu'il s'expriment sur cette aventure.
Tout le monde a particuliÃ¨rement Ã©tÃ© touchÃ© par cette expÃ©rience,... moi y compris.
Au delÃ  du projet, au cÅ“ur de la brousse, il y a eu la rÃ©alitÃ© des habitants, la vie lÃ -bas et les rencontres inattendues ; les dÃ©couvertes des europÃ©ens et les difficultÃ©s minimisÃ©es par les sourires, le plaisir d'Ãªtre ensemble et les Ã©motions ressenties, mais surtout le travail qu'ils Ã©taient venus rÃ©aliser.
Car, avant tout, ils y sont allÃ©s pour travailler.
J'ai mis six ans et demi pour rÃ©aliser ce film, tellement cette histoire Ã©tait forte et que je voulais la raconter telle que je l'avais vÃ©cue. Et pourtant l'Ã©motion est toujours lÃ . Pas de nostalgie, mais la certitude d'avoir partagÃ© des moments qui resteront, Ã  jamais, uniques.
La musique originale est de FranÃ§ois Garcia.

title: Burkina Faso honours legendary film-maker Idrissa Ouedraogo
description:
Burkina Faso, film lovers and movie buffs have gathered to remember the work of the legendary film-maker Idrissa Ouedraogo. He died on Sunday at the age of 64, from an undisclosed illness. Over his prolific career, Ouedraogo made more than 40 films and won several international awards  including the Grand Prize at the 1990 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Film documentaire sur le traitement du minerai sans mercure au Burkina Faso
description:
planetGOLD Burkina Faso a mis en place une installation sans mercure Ã  Gnikpiere, qui fonctionne Ã  plein rÃ©gime. Explorez comment cette initiative contribue Ã  la protection de l'environnement et Ã  l'amÃ©lioration des conditions de travail des mineurs artisanaux. Regardez le film documentaire, "L'Ã©mergence de nouveaux mineurs artisanaux", pour en savoir plus sur cette transition importante dans l'exploitation miniÃ¨re artisanale au Burkina Faso.
Rendez-vous sur https://www.planetgold.org/burkinafaso - https://www.planetgold.org/fr/burkina...

English:
planetGOLD Burkina Faso has installed a mercury-free facility in Gnikpiere that is up and running. Explore how this initiative is contributing to environmental protection and improving working conditions for artisanal miners. Watch the documentary, "The Emergence of New Artisanal Miners," to learn more about this significant transition in artisanal mining in Burkina Faso.

#MakeMercuryHistory #ResponsibleMining #BurkinaFaso  #EthicalGold #ResponsibleSourcing #ArtisanalGold #gold #ArtisanalMining #smallscalemining #mercuryfree

title: BRAVO, BURKINA! Trailer â€“ 2023 New African Film Festival
description:
BRAVO, BURKINA! 
Sun, March 19, 7:00 p.m.; Thurs, March 23, 7:00 p.m. 
 
Filmmaker and designer WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ© â€” whose fashion designs appear in Marvel's BLACK PANTHER films â€” crafts this imaginative debut feature about a BurkinabÃ¨ boy who migrates to Italy and later discovers a way to go back in time and regain what he lost. A multidimensional exploration of love and migration, this poetic story bends time to explore the meaning of existing in two states â€” both coming and going, running away and running toward. From the community in Burkina Faso to the two central protagonists walking the streets of an Italian village, OyÃ©jidÃ©'s characters exude humanity and confidence. OyÃ©jidÃ© is invested in evolving the narrative of migrants, leveraging his background in fashion to assert his characters' dignity and fullness. Direct confrontations with the camera lure viewers in while an evocative score guides them through a dreamy, mystical journey. A lyrical experience and one that flows beyond the frame, BRAVO, BURKINA! is a daring invitation to imagine what could be. (Note adapted from Sundance Film Festival.) Official Selection, 2023 Sundance Film Festival. DIR/SCR/PROD WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ©; PROD Giulia Alagna, Heather Barnes. U.S., 2023, color, 64 min. In Moore and Italian with English subtitles. NOT RATED 
 
For the full lineup and to purchase tickets and passes, visit: https://bit.ly/NewAfricanFF2023
 
CONNECT WITH AFI SILVER: http://AFI.com/Silver  
Twitter: @AFISilver  
FB & IG: @afisilvertheatre  
Podcast: bit.ly/SilverStreams  
 
#NewAfricanFilmFestival #AFISilverTheatre #FilmFestival #AfricanCinema

title: Burkina Faso - A Short Film
description:
A short film inspired from our travels to Burkina Faso, Africa while filming documentaries for A Better Life Foundation.

Directed, shot, and edited by Jacopo Campaiola for SmashWerks Films.

https://www.smashwerksfilms.com/

Check out A Better Life Foundation and see how you can help:
http://www.ablfusa.net/

title: Street Food In Burkina Faso - Rural Life And Living in West Africa, Burkina Faso
description:
Street Food In Burkina Faso - Rural Life And Living in West Africa, Burkina Faso

We take a walk on the streets of Burkina Faso Burkina Faso which shares border with Ghana. 
We get a real street view of Burkina Faso, we buy some street food , talk to the people and get a typical daily feel of life in Burkina Faso.

#WestAfrica #Burkina Faso #Africa #LifeInBurkina Faso #BurkinaFaso #StreetFood #StreetView

title: BurkinabÃ¨ Bounty: Agroecology in Burkina Faso | Documentary
description:
ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡«The documentary chronicles agricultural resistance and the fight for food sovereignty in Burkina Faso--a small, landlocked country in West Africa. Showcasing activist farmers, students, artists, and leaders in the local Slow Food movement, the film looks at how the BurkinabÃ¨ people are reclaiming their land and defending their traditions against the encroachment of corporate agribusiness.

From women gaining economic independence by selling artisanal "dolo" beer, to youth marching in the streets against companies like Monsanto, to hip-hop musicians setting up their own farms and reviving the revolutionary spirit of Thomas Sankara through their music, BURKINABÃˆ BOUNTY shows the creative tactics people are using to take back control of their food, seeds, and future.

=========

ğŸ¥  Director/Producer - Iara Lee  Korean-Brazilian ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡· activist filmmaker, world traveler and sports enthusiast.ğŸŠğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ğŸƒğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ ğŸš´ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ INSTAGRAM: @iaralee

title: Film africain - Samba TraorÃ© (Burkina Faso)
description:
SYNOPSIS
Apres avoir participe au hold-up d'une station service, Samba se refugie dans son village. Il retrouve Saratou qu'il epouse avant d'ouvrir le bar de ses reves avec son ami Salif. Mais le village s'interroge sur l'origine de ses moyens et quand Saratou doit partir accoucher a la ville, Samba comprend qu'il risque d'y etre reconnu...

description:
Lâ€™agroÃ©cologie permet lâ€™amÃ©lioration des productions agricoles par la valorisation des ressources naturelles locales et les savoir-faire traditionnels. Elle participe au maintien de la biodiversitÃ© et Ã  la restauration des terres en zones arides dans ces rÃ©gions gÃ©nÃ©ralement pauvres, oÃ¹ les contraintes physiques sont importantes. 

Dans le cadre du projet AVACLIM* lâ€™organisation burkinabÃ¨ ARFA et ses partenaires prÃ©sentent ici au travers de leurs pratiques et expÃ©riences que lâ€™agroÃ©cologie : 
- est gage dâ€™une alimentation saine et nutritive 
- permet une augmentation des revenus ainsi que la crÃ©ation dâ€™emplois 

*Le projet Avaclim â€“ financÃ© par le Fond pour lâ€™Environnement Mondial (mis en Å“uvre par la FAO), le Fond FranÃ§ais pour lâ€™Environnement Mondial (mis en Å“uvre par le CARI), et exÃ©cutÃ© par le CARI et ses partenaires - vise Ã  crÃ©er les conditions nÃ©cessaires au dÃ©ploiement de lâ€™agroÃ©cologie en zone aride. Des praticiens, agriculteurs et scientifiques Ã©tudient les initiatives agroÃ©cologiques de sept pays : Burkina Faso, SÃ©nÃ©gal, Maroc, Ethiopie, Afrique du Sud, BrÃ©sil et Inde pour faire la promotion de lâ€™agroÃ©cologie auprÃ¨s des instances politiques de ces pays et des instances intergouvernementales.

title: MASSOUD!, un film de Emmanuel Rotoubam MbaÃ¯dÃ© (Burkina Faso)
channel: L'AFRIQUE FAIT SON CINEMA, FESTIVAL DURABLE
description:
Massoud, a young and open-minded student works as a tourist guide in his spare time. He is passionate about culture and art. He is the only son of Barkaye, a respected and tolerant Imam of a small village community in the Sahel region.

His life will be turned upside down by the daily injustices he sees in his native region. The insecurity is getting out of hand. The straw that broke the camelâ€™s back will be the tragic killing of a close friend by the security forces. Little by little, Massoud gets radicalized and his discourse changes. His love affair with Flora, a journalist who came from Europe to investigate terrorism in the Sahel takes a hit, because of his growing interest in radical teachings. Massoud ends up joining a terrorist movement. The two lovers lose all contact, until the day he discovers Flora, kidnapped and jailed in one of the terrorist camp's cells along with other European nationals.

Day after day, attacks against civilians and security forces are organized and perpetrated by the terrorist leader and his henchmen. Under the cover of Islamism, the latter maintains various traffics with the help of Pascal, a European adventurer and former member of the special services. Pascal happens to find out that Flora, the journalist, is his natural daughter whom he conceived during one of his missions in the Sahel.

Paranoid and malicious, the terrorist leader Abdoulaye suspects Massoud's father of providing information to the security forces. He doesn't like the moderate speech of the imam who condemns in his sermons the attacks and the recruitment of young terrorists. The imam is a true advocate of tolerance, and gets more and more in the way of the radical terror movements.
One day, Abdoulaye decides to carry out an attack on the mosque and eliminate the moderate imam. It is to Massoud that he entrusts this task to eliminate his father.

Will Massoud accomplish his mission?

title: Pindoubane - An Educational Film in Jula / Dioula / Bambara from Burkina Faso
description: "Pindoubane" was produced by Troupe Brigue of Beregadougou and Peace Corps Burkina Faso. It has been viewed by thousands of West Africans and is currently screening aboard multiple bus lines, including Rahimo, TCV, and Rakieta. It includes many important lessons of family planning, women's empowerment, and health clinic de-stigmatization targeting rural and urban populations of southwest Burkina Faso.

title: Motorcycle prostitution in Burkina Faso | METROPOLIS
description:
Grace in Burkina Faso makes a good living with 'the oldest profession in the world' thanks to her motorcycle. It gives her prestige and it pays a lot better. 

Metropolis is a video project by Dutch broadcast organizations HUMAN and VPRO, that started in 2008. Metropolis is made by a global collective of young filmmakers and TV producers, reporting on remarkable stories from their own country or city.

More videos and full episodes on http://www.human.nl/metropolis

Â© HUMAN - This video is produced as part of the series Metropolis in 2021.

Quel film !', "This film is obviously beyond simple comments. It compels scholarly interests in terms of analysis. The Sun (s), the title of that book is a metaphor to indigenous and post colonial legendary personalities, such as Soundiata, Tieno Bocar, Lamizana and Madiba to name but a few. In addition, the film smartly compares these frican legends to the western scholars and great intellectual s who purposely distorted the image of Africa and denied africans from the very notion of intellegible humanity to vendicate the western dehumanizing practices like slavery colonialims and imperialism. Morever, the film talks directly to the african youth and diagnoses it state through the character of Dokamissa, the namesake of soundiata's grand mother. Dokamissa is sick, she doesn't recognize even his grand Father. This is where the film shows that african youth has forgotten it's pass. What is more dramatic Dokamissa knows Volter but not Tierno Bocar from Badiangara who has been and remains a knowledgeable wise man. 
  By the same time, this film is teaching about the Kouroukan fouga chatter which is ignored today though it is the world's first contitution. 
In brief terms, this film is revising the  glorious pass of Africa to teach the troubled and confused african youth in order to cure it from those sicknesses mainly provoked by the western knowledge. By western knowledge, I'M referring to the discursive production of african subject by the western scholars like Hegel and Victor Hugo.
Please. title: Film en langue MoorÃ¨ : Mariage forcÃ© et SIDA (Global Dialogues)
description:
Global Dialogues. Un film en langue MoorÃ¨ de FANTA NACRO.  L'histoire : Quand le riche Babacar demande Ã  Arouna la main de sa fille, Arouna est ravi. Plus tard, seul avec sa conscience, Arouna se rappelle quelques faits inquiÃ©tants sur Babacar: ses maintes maÃ®tresses, le fait qu'il ne prend pas le SIDA au sÃ©rieux. Mais est-ce que son inquiÃ©tude pour le bien-Ãªtre de sa fille l'emportera sur l'attrait des choses matÃ©rielles qu'offre Babacar? RÃ©alisÃ© par Fanta RÃ©gina Nacro ; basÃ© sur une idÃ©e  originale de Haby Fall, 20 ans, SÃ©nÃ©gal, et de son Ã©quipe. Un film de la collection SCENARIOS D'AFRIQUE produit par Global Dialogues (www.globaldialogues.org).
Facebook page: "Global Dialogues" -- please join us!
Global Dialogues: Established in 1997, Global Dialogues combines the creative genius of young people and the power of social change media to cultivate empathy, compassion and unity in diversity. We amplify youth voice in an innovative, intercreative program of social mobilization and global activism. Please join us in our efforts to envisage and create a healthier, more peaceful world.
The Global Dialogues films, based on stories submitted by creative youths in our contests, are crafted by leading filmmakers and emerging young talents. Available in numerous languages, the films reach over 200 million people every year.
Our vision: Global Dialogues envisions a healthy, peaceful world in which an empathetic and compassionate humanity flourishes in a spirit of equality and unity in diversity.
Global Dialogues' mission: To promote global public health and societal well-being through integrated, youth-driven solutions fueled by creativity and multidisciplinary partnership.
